meanings.sent1: The snake made sibilations as it slithered through the grass.
meanings.sent2: I heard the sibilations of the wind through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The sibilations of the kettle boiling on the stove sounded like a tiny snake.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like the sibilations of a thousand tiny serpents.
meanings.sent5: The sibilations of the leaking tire were a constant reminder of the need for repair.

meanings.definition: The act of producing a hissing sound
meanings.sent1: The performer's sibilations captivated the audience during the play.
meanings.sent2: She practiced her sibilations in front of the mirror to perfect her snake charmer act.
meanings.sent3: The sibilations of the children pretending to be snakes added a playful touch to the game.
meanings.sent4: His sibilations on the flute were so realistic, they could charm even real snakes.
meanings.sent5: The sibilations of the steam escaping from the teapot signaled that tea time had arrived.
